result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam Albert Dronso was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two, and consecutive to any other sentence. Straight time.  Credit for 44 fdays (4/13/15 to 5/26/15).

Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Bail posted for 15CF0045 to apply. Any remaining balance upon release to Extended Supervision shall be due by 6/1/15.  Failure to pay will result in an entry of a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one; and consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for 44 days (4/13/15 to 5/26/2015).

superMiscConds.notes:
No alcohol.
No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine or any body armor.
May not live where a firearm is kept.
No contact with Michael H.
No contact with Tany G.
No selling any items to pawn or resale shops or on the internet.
Notify DOC agent of all prescriptions within 72 hours of receiving prescription from any doctor.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment.  Successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting.
Court advised the defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended and that the defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison.  The defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to Extended Supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the defendant being returned to prison.

records.addlTxt: Count one.
Count two.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Bernadine D. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Bernadine D. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered defendant to serve 8 MONTHS in the House of Correction concurrent with count 2; and consecutive to any other sentence; straight time; credit for 44 days (04-13-2015 to 05-26-2015) time served. 

- Fine set at ZERO.

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS, concurrent with count 1; and consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 44 days (04-13-2015 to 05-26-2015) days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b).  Cash bail posted for 15CF0045 to apply. Any remaining balance upon release to extended supervision shall be due by 06-01-2015; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing. 
- Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 72 hours of receiving prescription from any Doctor.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
- Seek/Maintain Full Time employment.
- No contact with Michael H.
- No contact with Tanya G. 
- No selling any items to pawn or resale shops or on the internet.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;

Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;

Defendant Adam Albert Dronso in court with attorney Justin Singleton.  Defendant Adam Albert Dronso in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.

AS TO COUNT 1 AND 2:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Defendant Adam Albert Dronso in court with attorney Justin Singleton.  Defendant Adam Albert Dronso in custody.  Brandon Wigley for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defense counsel received discovery and offer and requests case be set for plea and sentencing.  Court orders case for adjourned Plea and Sentencing on 5-26-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Justin Singleton in court, defendant Adam Albert Dronso not in court, in custody.  Brandon Wigley for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant not produced. Defense counsel waives defendants appearance.
Defense states another attorney appeared at the previous hearing and he has not yet reviewed the discovery. Court orders case adjourned to allow the Defense time to review the discovery and offer. Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference on 5-7-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Original Transcript (11 pages) commencing 04/23/2015 PRELIMINARY HEARING received and filed.

Defendant Adam Albert Dronso in court with attorney Justin Singleton.  Defendant Adam Albert Dronso in custody.  Nicholas Cerwin for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Michael Maldonado-MPD Officer. Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #15C259 and 14CF5521 that are attached to the complaint.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Adam Albert Dronso in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Defendant Adam Albert Dronso in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant plead not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNT 1. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge STARK, Branch 17.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
